markdown: For several days OpenRailwayMap [visualizes](http://blog.openrailwaymap.org/?lang

Eike Beer [reports](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2015-November/000370.html) how to set up a development version of OpenRailwayMap which uses the vector tiles provided by openrailwaymap.org.
Michael Reichert [created](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2015-November/000370.html) a JOSM preset for mapping tram signals in Germany.

The developers of OpenRailwayMap ponder on using OpenHistoricalMap as a data source for abandoned and razed railways instead of OpenStreetMap. Michael [asks](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/historic/2015-November/000944.html) at Historical mailing list what to consider when copying data from OSM to OHM.
The OpenRailwayMap Blog [reports](http://blog.openrailwaymap.org/?lang

On the OpenRailwayMap mailing list Alexander Matheisen [proposes](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2016-March/000408.html) a tag to map the importance of train stations. This is based on a proposal by user Skunk from 2009 [modified](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2016-March/000410.html) to be more useable in large countries (e.g. USA).
OpenRailwayMap now also [supports](http://blog.openrailwaymap.org/?lang

Denis Stein [asks](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2016-September/000507.html) on the OpenRailwayMap mailing list where exactly and how to map points (switches, turnouts), and makes some suggestions.
Jojo4u [asks](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/archives/openrailwaymap/2016-September/000508.html) if `railway

Alexander Matheisen [explains](http://lists.openrailwaymap.org/pipermail/openrailwaymap/2017-April/000568.html) on the OpenRailwayMap mailing list, why he will remove the experimental support of vector tiles from openrailwaymap.org.

Several German news websites [published](https://www.morgenpost.de/web-wissen/web-technik/article213514693/Open-Railway-Map-ist-ein-Kartenparadies-fuer-Bahnfreunde.html) a brief article on OpenRailwayMap.

Osmose now [uses](https://mobile.twitter.com/osmose_qa/status/1126102401616896000) the [MapCSS](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/MapCSS) validation rules of the OpenRailwayMap project to validate railway infrastructure.

The [Einfachbahn](http://einfachbahn.de/) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=http://einfachbahn.de/)) initiative [organised](https://lists.openrailwaymap.org/pipermail/openrailwaymap/2019-August/000612.html)  ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://lists.openrailwaymap.org/pipermail/openrailwaymap/2019-August/000612.html)) a [mapping party](https://michreichert.de/share/public/190716-mappingparty-einfachbahn.pdf) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) in Frankfurt am Main on 12 September. Two groups practised the acquisition of railway-related geodata in Frankfurt-Höchst and Frankfurt-Rödelheim stations and subsequently edited with JOSM. In addition to mapping, there was a lively exchange of information on railway geodata.

... [OpenRailwayMap](https://openrailwaymap.org/)? This OpenStreetMap-based site is actively discussed in the [rails_dev](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/rails-dev/2019-November/017276.html) discussion list.

Trying to identify [@anonymaps](https://twitter.com/Anonymaps)? You can exclude the weeklyOSM proofreaders from your list of suspects. As they rightly [pointed out](https://twitter.com/Anonymaps/status/1201484324320808960), OpenRailWayMap development isn’t discussed in the rails_dev list. Rails is a web framework that powers, amongst others, the OpenStreetMap.org website. If you'd rather help create a world-wide, open, up-to-date and detailed map of the railway network, based on OpenStreetMap, then you'll find them on the [OpenRailWayMap mail list](https://lists.openrailwaymap.org/mailman/listinfo/openrailwaymap).

Chuck Sanders [is seeking](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-us/2020-June/020102.html) a consensus for [suggestions](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Talk:OpenRailwayMap/Tagging_in_North_America) on rail tagging, in particular how to use `reporting_marks= `  and `operator= `.

The German 'FragDenStaat' ('Ask the Government') [answered](https://fragdenstaat.de/anfrage/gleisplan-fur-deutschland/#nachricht-494626) ![(de)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/de.svg) > [![en](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2020/09/en-green.svg)](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://fragdenstaat.de/anfrage/gleisplan-fur-deutschland/#nachricht-494626) a query looking for a map of public railways in Germany by referring to [openrailwaymap.org](https://openrailwaymap.org), among other things.

We have received two comments regarding issue #556. Here are some clarifications on these subjects: 

  We [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14381#wn556_24600) Bert -Araali- Van Opstal's complaint about some behaviour on Discord. Mateusz Konieczny, leader of the  'OSM World' moderators team on [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/4smYkq3gzp) (account needed) noted that the nine moderators from around the world have taken this complaint seriously. However, after hours of searching through the logs for the abusive comments described by Bert they were unable to find them. They reminded users that anyone on the discussion groups can contact the moderators directly (message @ModMail) to report abusive, racist, or insulting language. 

  Our [statement](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14381#wn556_24609) that there is a radio amateur on the current OSMF board is not correct. While we have learnt that one can find amateur radio operators actively contributing to the Overpass API, helping in the OSMF MWG, as founders of projects such as OpenRailwayMap, and in many other roles, we also learnt that there isn't one on the OSMF board.

As the weeklyOSM volunteer writers and editors cannot systematically go through all discussion and forum threads or social media posts, it is up to you to follow the links, read further, form your own opinions, and participate in the discussions. You can also reach us easily if you would like report and contribute to brief summaries of discussions to contribute to a better weeklyOSM.

Let's have fun and maintain a respectful and enjoyable environment!

Raster tile provider [Tracestrack](https://www.tracestrack.com) has open sourced [Tracesmap](https://tracesmap.com), their generic online map, on [GitHub](https://github.com/tracestrack/tracesmap.com). The map integrates many OpenStreetMap based services such as Tracestrack raster tiles, OpenRouteService, Overpass API, Nominatim search and OpenRailwayMap, as well as some commercial products like Mapbox satellite imagery, and TomTom Traffic.
OpenRailwayMap [announced](https://blog.openrailwaymap.org/?lang

_Periodismo.com_ [reviewed](https://www.periodismo.com/2023/12/30/todos-los-trenes-del-mundo-en-un-solo-mapa/) :ES-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-periodismo-com.translate.goog/2023/12/30/todos-los-trenes-del-mundo-en-un-solo-mapa/?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) OpenRailwayMap, a map of the world's railway lines using data from OpenStreetMap.

Prajna [wrote](https://twitter.com/adepedia/status/1769298410333741289) :ID-s: a viral Twitter thread about the maximum speed of Indonesian railways based on OpenRailwayMap, which is built using OpenStreetMap data. People in the comments are intrigued and fascinated by the data visualisation of OpenRailwayMap and how OpenStreetMap can store such detailed information about railway specifications. On another occasion, a public transportation analyst [utilised](https://twitter.com/txttransportasi/status/1767022633609056660) :ID-s: OpenRailwayMap as a basis for their argument regarding potential improvements to the current rail system.

Hidde has [released](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/openrailwaymap-vector-announcement/126995) OpenRailwayMap-Vector, a re-implementation of OpenRailwayMap utilising vector tiles. The project currently covers Europe and North America, with plans underway to expand globally with daily updates.
